duck: Montreal Biosphère, a geodesic dome in Montreal, Canada
Biosphere (musician) (born 1962), recording name of Geir Jenssen, a Norwegian musician
biosphere definition: the part of the world in which life can exist.
BIOS-3, the first man made biosphere for sustaining humans in a closed ecology
Biosphere 2, an artificial closed ecological system in Oracle, Arizona
A biosphere is the part of a planet's shell where all life occurs; a self-regulating, closed ecological system.

milestones: NASA unveils detailed map of Antarctica
Evolution may occur faster than once thought, scientists claim
Largest mass extinction in 65 million years underway, scientists say

composite of global oceanic and terrestrial photoautotroph abundance, from
 September 1997 to August 2000. Provided by the SeaWiFS Project, NASA/Goddard
 Space Flight Center and ORBIMAGE.]]

The 'biosphere' is the global sum of all ecosystems. It can also be called the
zone of life on Earth, a closed (apart from solar and cosmic radiation and heat
from the interior of the Earth), and self-regulating system.<ref name =
"ColumbiaEncyc"> {{Cite encyclopedia
  | encyclopedia = The Columbia Encyclopedia, Sixth Edition publisher = Columbia
  | University Press year = 2004 accessdate = 2010-11-12 url =
  | http://www.questia.com/library/encyclopedia/biosphere.jsp
}}</ref> From the broadest biophysiological point of view, the biosphere is the
global ecological system integrating all living beings and their relationships,
including their interaction with the elements of the lithosphere, hydrosphere,
and atmosphere. The biosphere is postulated to have evolved, beginning through a
process of biogenesis or biopoesis, at least some 3.5 billion years ago.<ref
name="Campbell 2006"></ref>

In a broader sense; biospheres are any closed, self-regulating systems
containing ecosystems; including artificial ones such as Biosphere 2 and BIOS-3;
and, potentially, ones on other planets or moons.<ref name =
"webdictionary.co.uk">{{cite web
  | title = Meaning of biosphere work = WebDictionary.co.uk publisher =
  | WebDictionary.co.uk url =
  | http://www.webdictionary.co.uk/definition.php?query=biosphere accessdate =
  | 2010-11-12}}
</ref>
